ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Quantum II is a great course that builds on the Quantum theory established in first semester and introduces interesting and applicable topics in Quantum Optics, Scattering, and Many Body theory.
Yes, a very important basic course in quantum physics.
This course is very good! Jack Harris has put together a very interesting set of topics including a section on quantum optics. I would definitely recommend the course to all!

Scattering, a little relativistic QM, and some advanced stuff, like second quantization. I highly recommend it, especially the second quantization bits, because they really offered a new way to think about QM.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course has covered topics which may prove useful in my research.
Not sure yet as I have not decided on my research topic.
I was not interested in this material.
